member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFBookmark_GetFirstChild
member.summary: Get the first child of |bookmark|, or the first top-level bookmark item.
member.param: Handle to the document.
Handle to the current bookmark. Pass NULL for the first top level item.
member.returns: Returns a handle to the first child of |bookmark| or the first top-level bookmark item. NULL if no child or top-level bookmark found.
member.remarks: FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_BOOKMARK FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFBookmark_GetFirstChild(FPDF_DOCUMENT document, FPDF_BOOKMARK bookmark);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFBookmark_GetNextSibling
member.summary: Get the next sibling of |bookmark|.
member.param: Handle to the document.
Handle to the current bookmark.
member.returns: Returns a handle to the next sibling of |bookmark|, or NULL if this is the last bookmark at this level.
member.remarks: FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_BOOKMARK FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFBookmark_GetNextSibling(FPDF_DOCUMENT document, FPDF_BOOKMARK bookmark);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFBookmark_GetTitle
member.summary: Get the title of |bookmark|.
member.param: Handle to the bookmark.
Buffer for the title. May be NULL.
The length of the buffer in bytes. May be 0.
member.returns: Returns the number of bytes in the title, including the terminating NUL character. The number of bytes is returned regardless of the |buffer| and |buflen| parameters.
member.remarks: Regardless of the platform, the |buffer| is always in UTF-16LE encoding. The string is terminated by a UTF16 NUL character. If |buflen| is less than the required length, or |buffer| is NULL, |buffer| will not be modified. FPDF_EXPORT unsigned long FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFBookmark_GetTitle(FPDF_BOOKMARK bookmark, void* buffer, unsigned long buflen);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFBookmark_Find
member.summary: Find the bookmark with |title| in |document|.
member.param: Handle to the document.
The UTF-16LE encoded Unicode title for which to search.
member.returns: Returns the handle to the bookmark, or NULL if |title| can't be found.
member.remarks: FPDFBookmark_Find() will always return the first bookmark found even if multiple bookmarks have the same |title|. FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_BOOKMARK FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFBookmark_Find(FPDF_DOCUMENT document, FPDF_WIDESTRING title);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFBookmark_GetDest
member.summary: Get the destination associated with |bookmark|.
member.param: Handle to the document.
Handle to the bookmark.
member.returns: Returns the handle to the destination data, NULL if no destination is associated with |bookmark|.
member.remarks: FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_DEST FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFBookmark_GetDest(FPDF_DOCUMENT document, FPDF_BOOKMARK bookmark);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFBookmark_GetAction
member.summary: Get the action associated with |bookmark|.
member.param: Handle to the bookmark.
member.returns: Returns the handle to the action data, or NULL if no action is associated with |bookmark|. When NULL is returned, FPDFBookmark_GetDest() should be called to get the |bookmark| destination data.
member.remarks: FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_ACTION FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFBookmark_GetAction(FPDF_BOOKMARK bookmark);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFAction_GetType
member.summary: Get the type of |action|.
member.param: Handle to the action.
member.returns: Returns one of: PDFACTION_UNSUPPORTED, PDFACTION_GOTO, PDFACTION_REMOTEGOTO, PDFACTION_URI, PDFACTION_LAUNCH.
member.remarks: FPDF_EXPORT unsigned long FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFAction_GetType(FPDF_ACTION action);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFAction_GetDest
member.summary: Get the destination of |action|.
member.param: Handle to the document.
Handle to the action. |action| must be a |PDFACTION_GOTO| or |PDFACTION_REMOTEGOTO|.
member.returns: Returns a handle to the destination data, or NULL on error, typically because the arguments were bad or the action was of the wrong type.
member.remarks: In the case of |PDFACTION_REMOTEGOTO|, you must first call FPDFAction_GetFilePath(), then load the document at that path, then pass the document handle from that document as |document| to FPDFAction_GetDest(). FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_DEST FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFAction_GetDest(FPDF_DOCUMENT document, FPDF_ACTION action);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFAction_GetFilePath
member.summary: Get the file path of |action|.
member.param: Handle to the action. |action| must be a |PDFACTION_LAUNCH| or |PDFACTION_REMOTEGOTO|.
A buffer for output the path string. May be NULL.
The length of the buffer, in bytes. May be 0.
member.returns: Returns the number of bytes in the file path, including the trailing NUL character, or 0 on error, typically because the arguments were bad or the action was of the wrong type.
member.remarks: Regardless of the platform, the |buffer| is always in UTF-8 encoding. If |buflen| is less than the returned length, or |buffer| is NULL, |buffer| will not be modified. FPDF_EXPORT unsigned long FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFAction_GetFilePath(FPDF_ACTION action, void* buffer, unsigned long buflen);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFAction_GetURIPath
member.summary: Get the URI path of |action|.
member.param: Handle to the document.
Handle to the action. Must be a |PDFACTION_URI|.
A buffer for the path string. May be NULL.
The length of the buffer, in bytes. May be 0.
member.returns: Returns the number of bytes in the URI path, including the trailing NUL character, or 0 on error, typically because the arguments were bad or the action was of the wrong type.
member.remarks: The |buffer| is always encoded in 7-bit ASCII. If |buflen| is less than the returned length, or |buffer| is NULL, |buffer| will not be modified. FPDF_EXPORT unsigned long FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFAction_GetURIPath(FPDF_DOCUMENT document, FPDF_ACTION action, void* buffer, unsigned long buflen);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFDest_GetDestPageIndex
member.summary: Get the page index of |dest|.
member.param: Handle to the document.
Handle to the destination.
member.returns: Returns the 0-based page index containing |dest|. Returns -1 on error.
member.remarks: FPDF_EXPORT int FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFDest_GetDestPageIndex(FPDF_DOCUMENT document, FPDF_DEST dest);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFDest_GetLocationInPage
member.summary: Get the (x, y, zoom) location of |dest| in the destination page, if the destination is in [page /XYZ x y zoom] syntax.
member.param: Handle to the destination.
Out parameter; true if the x value is not null.
Out parameter; true if the y value is not null.
Out parameter; true if the zoom value is not null.
Out parameter; the x coordinate, in page coordinates.
Out parameter; the y coordinate, in page coordinates.
Out parameter; the zoom value.
member.returns: Returns TRUE on successfully reading the /XYZ value.
member.remarks: Note the [x, y, zoom] values are only set if the corresponding hasXVal, hasYVal or hasZoomVal flags are true. FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_BOOL FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFDest_GetLocationInPage(FPDF_DEST dest, FPDF_BOOL* hasXVal, FPDF_BOOL* hasYVal, FPDF_BOOL* hasZoomVal, FS_FLOAT* x, FS_FLOAT* y, FS_FLOAT* zoom);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFLink_GetLinkAtPoint
member.summary: Find a link at point (|x|,|y|) on |page|.
member.param: Handle to the document page.
The x coordinate, in the page coordinate system.
The y coordinate, in the page coordinate system.
member.returns: Returns a handle to the link, or NULL if no link found at the given point.
member.remarks: You can convert coordinates from screen coordinates to page coordinates using FPDF_DeviceToPage(). FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_LINK FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFLink_GetLinkAtPoint(FPDF_PAGE page, double x, double y);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFLink_GetLinkZOrderAtPoint
member.summary: Find the Z-order of link at point (|x|,|y|) on |page|.
member.param: Handle to the document page.
The x coordinate, in the page coordinate system.
The y coordinate, in the page coordinate system.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDF_GetMetaText
member.summary: Get meta-data |tag| content from |document|.
member.param: Handle to the document.

The tag to retrieve. The tag can be one of: Title, Author, Subject, Keywords, Creator, Producer, CreationDate, or ModDate. For detailed explanations of these tags and their respective values, please refer to PDF Reference 1.6, section 10.2.1, 'Document Information Dictionary'.
A buffer for the tag. May be NULL.
The length of the buffer, in bytes. May be 0.
member.returns: Returns the number of bytes in the tag, including trailing zeros.
member.remarks: The |buffer| is always encoded in UTF-16LE. The |buffer| is followed by two bytes of zeros indicating the end of the string. If |buflen| is less than the returned length, or |buffer| is NULL, |buffer| will not be modified. For linearized files, FPDFAvail_IsFormAvail must be called before this, and it must have returned PDF_FORM_AVAIL or PDF_FORM_NOTEXIST. Before that, there is no guarantee the metadata has been loaded. FPDF_EXPORT unsigned long FPDF_CALLCONV FPDF_GetMetaText(FPDF_DOCUMENT document, FPDF_BYTESTRING tag, void* buffer, unsigned long buflen);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDF_GetPageLabel
member.summary: Get the page label for |page_index| from |document|.
member.param: Handle to the document.
The 0-based index of the page.
A buffer for the page label. May be NULL.
The length of the buffer, in bytes. May be 0.
member.returns: Returns the number of bytes in the page label, including trailing zeros.
member.remarks: The |buffer| is always encoded in UTF-16LE. The |buffer| is followed by two bytes of zeros indicating the end of the string. If |buflen| is less than the returned length, or |buffer| is NULL, |buffer| will not be modified. FPDF_EXPORT unsigned long FPDF_CALLCONV FPDF_GetPageLabel(FPDF_DOCUMENT document, int page_index, void* buffer, unsigned long buflen);.

member.summary: Release all resources allocated by the FPDFSDK library.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDF_LoadDocument
member.summary: Open and load a PDF document.
member.param: Path to the PDF file (including extension).
A string used as the password for the PDF file. If no password is needed, empty or NULL can be used. See comments below regarding the encoding.
member.returns: A handle to the loaded document, or NULL on failure.
member.remarks: Loaded document can be closed by FPDF_CloseDocument(). If this function fails, you can use FPDF_GetLastError() to retrieve the reason why it failed. The encoding for |password| can be either UTF-8 or Latin-1. PDFs, depending on the security handler revision, will only accept one or the other encoding. If |password|'s encoding and the PDF's expected encoding do not match, FPDF_LoadDocument() will automatically convert |password| to the other encoding. FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_DOCUMENT FPDF_CALLCONV FPDF_LoadDocument(FPDF_STRING file_path, FPDF_BYTESTRING password);.

member.summary: Render contents of a page to a device independent bitmap.

Handle to the page. Returned by FPDF_LoadPage.
Left pixel position of the display area in bitmap coordinates.
Top pixel position of the display area in bitmap coordinates.
Horizontal size (in pixels) for displaying the page.
Vertical size (in pixels) for displaying the page.
Page orientation: 0 (normal), 1 (rotated 90 degrees clockwise), 2 (rotated 180 degrees), 3 (rotated 90 degrees counter-clockwise).

0 for normal display, or combination of the Page Rendering flags defined above. With the FPDF_ANNOT flag, it renders all annotations that do not require user-interaction, which are all annotations except widget and popup annotations.

The transform matrix, which must be invertible. See PDF Reference 1.7, 4.2.2 Common Transformations.
The rect to clip to in device coords.

0 for normal display, or combination of the Page Rendering flags defined above. With the FPDF_ANNOT flag, it renders all annotations that do not require user-interaction, which are all annotations except widget and popup annotations.
member.remarks: FPDF_EXPORT void FPDF_CALLCONV FPDF_RenderPageBitmapWithMatrix(FPDF_BITMAP bitmap, FPDF_PAGE page, const FS_MATRIX* matrix, const FS_RECTF* clipping, int flags);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDF_DeviceToPage
member.summary: Convert the screen coordinates of a point to page coordinates.
member.param: Handle to the page. Returned by FPDF_LoadPage.
Left pixel position of the display area in device coordinates.
Top pixel position of the display area in device coordinates.
Horizontal size (in pixels) for displaying the page.
Vertical size (in pixels) for displaying the page.
Page orientation: 0 (normal) 1 (rotated 90 degrees clockwise) 2 (rotated 180 degrees) 3 (rotated 90 degrees counter-clockwise).
X value in device coordinates to be converted.
Y value in device coordinates to be converted.
A pointer to a double receiving the converted X value in page coordinates.
A pointer to a double receiving the converted Y value in page coordinates.
member.returns: Returns true if the conversion succeeds, and page_x and page_y successfully receives the converted coordinates.
member.remarks: The page coordinate system has its origin at the left-bottom corner of the page, with the X-axis on the bottom going to the right, and the Y-axis on the left side going up. NOTE: this coordinate system can be altered when you zoom, scroll, or rotate a page, however, a point on the page should always have the same coordinate values in the page coordinate system. The device coordinate system is device dependent. For screen device, its origin is at the left-top corner of the window. However this origin can be altered by the Windows coordinate transformation utilities. You must make sure the start_x, start_y, size_x, size_y and rotate parameters have exactly same values as you used in the FPDF_RenderPage() function call. FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_BOOL FPDF_CALLCONV FPDF_DeviceToPage(FPDF_PAGE page, int start_x, int start_y, int size_x, int size_y, int rotate, int device_x, int device_y, double* page_x, double* page_y);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDF_PageToDevice
member.summary: Convert the page coordinates of a point to screen coordinates.
member.param: Handle to the page. Returned by FPDF_LoadPage.
Left pixel position of the display area in device coordinates.
Top pixel position of the display area in device coordinates.

Vertical size (in pixels) for displaying the page.
Page orientation: 0 (normal) 1 (rotated 90 degrees clockwise) 2 (rotated 180 degrees) 3 (rotated 90 degrees counter-clockwise).
X value in page coordinates.
Y value in page coordinate.
A pointer to an integer receiving the result X value in device coordinates.
A pointer to an integer receiving the result Y value in device coordinates.
member.returns: Returns true if the conversion succeeds, and device_x and device_y successfully receives the converted coordinates.
member.remarks: See . FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_BOOL FPDF_CALLCONV FPDF_PageToDevice(FPDF_PAGE page, int start_x, int start_y, int size_x, int size_y, int rotate, double page_x, double page_y, int* device_x, int* device_y);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFBitmap_Create
member.summary: Create a device independent bitmap (FXDIB).
member.param: The number of pixels in width for the bitmap. Must be greater than 0.
The number of pixels in height for the bitmap. Must be greater than 0.
A flag indicating whether the alpha channel is used. Non-zero for using alpha, zero for not using.
member.returns: The created bitmap handle, or NULL if a parameter error or out of memory.
member.remarks: The bitmap always uses 4 bytes per pixel. The first byte is always double word aligned. The byte order is BGRx (the last byte unused if no alpha channel) or BGRA. The pixels in a horizontal line are stored side by side, with the left most pixel stored first (with lower memory address). Each line uses width * 4 bytes. Lines are stored one after another, with the top most line stored first. There is no gap between adjacent lines. This function allocates enough memory for holding all pixels in the bitmap, but it doesn't initialize the buffer. Applications can use FPDFBitmap_FillRect() to fill the bitmap using any color. If the OS allows it, this function can allocate up to 4 GB of memory. FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_BITMAP FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFBitmap_Create(int width, int height, int alpha);.

member.name: T:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.Bridge.PDFiumDelegates.FPDFBitmap_CreateEx
member.summary: Create a device independent bitmap (FXDIB).
member.param: The number of pixels in width for the bitmap. Must be greater than 0.
The number of pixels in height for the bitmap. Must be greater than 0.
A number indicating for bitmap format, as defined above.
A pointer to the first byte of the first line if using an external buffer. If this parameter is NULL, then the a new buffer will be created.
Number of bytes for each scan line, for external buffer only.
member.returns: The bitmap handle, or NULL if parameter error or out of memory.
member.remarks: Similar to FPDFBitmap_Create function, but allows for more formats and an external buffer is supported. The bitmap created by this function can be used in any place that a FPDF_BITMAP handle is required. If an external buffer is used, then the application should destroy the buffer by itself. FPDFBitmap_Destroy function will not destroy the buffer. FPDF_EXPORT FPDF_BITMAP FPDF_CALLCONV FPDFBitmap_CreateEx(int width, int height, int format, void* first_scan, int stride);.

member.name: M:PDFiumDotNET.Wrapper.NativeMethods.GetLastError
member.summary: Retrieves the calling thread's last-error code value. The last-error code is maintained on a per-thread basis. Multiple threads do not overwrite each other's last-error code.
member.returns: The return value is the calling thread's last-error code.

The location of the message definition.
The message identifier for the requested message.
The language identifier for the requested message.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the null-terminated string that specifies the formatted message.
